item.title: Mollie add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "Stories are for joining the past to the future. Stories are for those late hours in the night when you can't remember how you got from where you were to where you are. Stories ar for eternity, when memory is erased, when there is nothing to remember except the story." -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Gerda Weissmann Klein
item.description: "Ilse, a childhood friend of mine, once found a raspberry in the concentration camp and carried it in her pocket all day to present to me that night on a leaf. Imagine a world in which your entire possession is one raspberry and you give it to your friend." -- Gerda Weissmann Klein

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "It was very sad, he thought. The things men carried inside. The things men did or felt they had to do. " -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Gerda Weissmann Klein
item.description: "He said I could make him happy. Then I understood the cause of my sadness. I didn't want to make anybody happy. I wanted someone to make me happy. I knew that there was laughter and I wanted someone who could laugh with me. " -- Gerda Weissmann Klein

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "They carried all they could bear, and then some, including a silent awe for the terrible power of the things they carried." -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "Someone who thinks death is the scariest thing doesn't know a thing about life." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Mollie add a quote by K.L. Going
item.description:
"Whats ironic,” he adds, shaking his head, “is that everyone’s so busy trying not to look like they’re looking at you that they’re really not looking at you.”
Wait. So what you’re saying…” I pause. “What you’re saying is…people aren’t really looking at me?" -- K.L. Going

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Elizabeth Scott
item.description:
"The story of my life can be told in silver: in chocolate mills, serving spoons, and services for twelve. The story of my life has nothing to do with me. The story of my life is things. Things that aren’t mine, that won’t ever be mine. It’s all I’ve ever known.
I wish it wasn’t." -- Elizabeth Scott

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Laura Wiess
item.description: "We mutinied quietly, using every lesson we’d been taught by every person who’d ever used us for their own benefit." -- Laura Wiess

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Jennifer Ziegler
item.description: "Tip: Unpopularity is a state of mind. Feel nerdy. Think uncool thoughts. It also helps to use the word “vaginal” a lot." -- Jennifer Ziegler

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "Family isn’t something that’s supposed to be static, or set. People marry in, divorce out. They’re born, they die. It’s always evolving, turning into something else." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Elizabeth Scott
item.description: "Things change. Stuff happens. Life goes on." -- Elizabeth Scott

item.title: Mollie add a quote by John Green
item.description: "In the first century CE, Roman authorities punished St. Apollonia by crushing her teeth one by one with pliers. Colin often thought about this in relationship to the monotony of dumping: we have thirty-two teeth. After a while, having each tooth individually destroyed probably gets repetitive, even dull. But it never stops hurting." -- John Green

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Sara Zarr
item.description: ". . .There are certain people who come into your life, and leave a mark. . . Their place in your heart is tender; a bruise of longing, a pulse of unfinished business. Just hearing their names pushes and pulls at you in a hundred ways, and when you try to define those hundred ways, describe them even to yourself, words are useless." -- Sara Zarr

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Gabrielle Zevin
item.description: "You forget all of it anyway. . . You forget who was cool and who was not, who was pretty, smart, athletic, and not. . . You forget all of them. Even the ones you said you loved, and even the ones you actually did. They’re the last to go. And then once you’ve forgotten enough, you love someone else." -- Gabrielle Zevin

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Laurie Halse Anderson
item.description: "Everybody told me to be a man. Nobody told me how." -- Laurie Halse Anderson

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Jay Asher
item.description: "You don’t know what goes on in anyone’s life but your own. And when you mess with one part of a person’s life, you’re not messing with just that part. Unfortunately, you can’t be that precise and selective. When you mess with one part of a person’s life, you’re messing with their entire life. Everything. . . affects everything." -- Jay Asher

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Rachel Cohn
item.description: "I Wanna Hold Your Hand.’ First single. Fucking brilliant. Perhaps the most fucking brilliant song ever written. Because they nailed it. That’s what everyone wants. Not 24-7 hot wet sex. Not a marriage that lasts a hundred years. Not a Porsche or a blow job or a million-dollar crib. No. They wanna hold your hand. They have a feeling that they can’t hide." -- Rachel Cohn

item.title: Mollie add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "There's no use going to school unless your final destination is the library." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Do you know that books smell like nutmeg or some spice from a foreign land? I loved to smell them when I was a boy. Lord, there were a lot of lovely books once, before we let them go." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "There is more than one way to burn a book. And the world is full of people running about with lit matches." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "There must be something in books, something we can’t imagine, to make a woman stay in a burning house; there must be something there. You don’t stay for nothing." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Half the fun of the travel is the esthetic of lostness." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I still love books. Nothing a computer can do can compare to a book. You can't really put a book on the Internet. Three companies have offered to put books by me on the Net, and I said, 'If you can make something that has a nice jacket, nice paper with that nice smell, then we'll talk.' All the computer can give you is a manuscript. People don't want to read manuscripts. They want to read books. Books smell good. They look good. You can press it to your bosom. You can carry it in your pocket." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "A book is a loaded gun in the house next door...Who knows who might be the target of the well-read man?" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I don't believe in colleges and universities. I believe in libraries because most students don't have any money. When I graduated from high school, it was during the Depression and we had no money. I couldn't go to college, so I went to the library three days a week for 10 years." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "The good writers touch life often. The mediocre ones run a quick hand over her. The bad ones rape her and leave her for the flies." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Books are flesh-and-blood ideas and cry out, silently, when put to the torch." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Mollie add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Teachers are to inspire; librarians are to fulfill." -- Ray Bradbury
